    • POMA: R Package for Statistical Analysis of Mass Spectrometry Data

POMA: R Package for Statistical Analysis of Mass Spectrometry Data

Pol Castellano-Escuder

2020-01-29

Source: vignettes/POMA-demo.Rmd
POMA-demo.Rmd

Load POMA

library(POMA)

Load MSnbase::MSnSet() object

data(st000284)

Impute Missing Values

imputed <- PomaImpute(st000284, ZerosAsNA = T, RemoveNA = T, cutoff = 20, method = "knn")
imputed
## MSnSet (storageMode: lockedEnvironment)
## assayData: 113 features, 132 samples 
##   element names: exprs 
## protocolData: none
## phenoData
##   sampleNames: Subject_1 Subject_2 ... Subject_132 (132 total)
##   varLabels: Group ageatconsent ... drink_alcohol (5 total)
##   varMetadata: labelDescription
## featureData: none
## experimentData: use 'experimentData(object)'
## Annotation:  
## - - - Processing information - - -
## Imputed (knn): Wed Jan 29 11:20:04 2020 
##  MSnbase version: 2.10.1

Volcano Plot

PomaVolcano(imputed, pval = "raw")

Normalization

normalized <- PomaNorm(imputed, method = "log_pareto")
normalized
## MSnSet (storageMode: lockedEnvironment)
## assayData: 113 features, 132 samples 
##   element names: exprs 
## protocolData: none
## phenoData
##   sampleNames: Subject_1 Subject_2 ... Subject_132 (132 total)
##   varLabels: Group ageatconsent ... drink_alcohol (5 total)
##   varMetadata: labelDescription
## featureData: none
## experimentData: use 'experimentData(object)'
## Annotation:  
## - - - Processing information - - -
## Normalised (log_pareto): Wed Jan 29 11:20:07 2020 
##  MSnbase version: 2.10.1

Not Normalized Data

PomaNormPlot(imputed, group = "samples")
## Using ID, Group as id variables

Normalized Data

PomaNormPlot(normalized, group = "samples")
## Using ID, Group as id variables

Principal Component Analysis

multiv_pca <- PomaMultivariate(normalized, 
                               method = "pca",
                               components = 5,
                               scale = FALSE,
                               center = FALSE)

Scree Plot

multiv_pca$screeplot

Scores Plot

multiv_pca$scoresplot

Score Table

head(multiv_pca$score_data)
##               PC1    PC2     PC3     PC4     PC5
## Subject_1 -0.4920 3.2223 -0.4056 -0.9602 -0.1377
## Subject_2 -1.4216 2.5342 -1.5620 -0.3542  3.0973
## Subject_3  2.4304 1.1799  1.0433 -0.3040  0.4411
## Subject_4 -0.7437 3.7469 -2.4490 -1.4468  0.7222
## Subject_5 -0.7866 0.9041 -1.0319  2.5226 -0.9203
## Subject_6  1.3134 2.0314 -3.0247  4.2086  1.3496
